Package alix.lucene

Class Alix

  • java.lang.Object
    • alix.lucene.Alix
  • public class Alix
extends Object

    An Alix object is a wrapper around a Lucene index with lexical tools, to be shared across a complex application (ex: web servlet). Instantiation is not public to ensure uniqueness of threadsafe Lucene objects (Directory, IndexReader, IndexSearcher, IndexWriter and Analyzer). Use #instance(Path, Analyzer) to get an Alix instance, and get from it what you need for your classical Lucene bizness.

    • reader()
    • writer()
    • searcher()
    • analyzer()

    An Alix object will also produce different lists and stats concerning all index. These results are cached cache(String, Object) (to avoid recalculation). Data are usually available as custom objects, optimized for statistics.

    • fieldInt(String) All values of a unique numeric field per document (IntPoint, NumericDocValuesField).
    • fieldText(String) All search indexed in a TextField, with stats, useful for list of search and advanced lexical statistics.
    • docOccs(String) Size (in tokens) of indexed documents in a TextField
    • fieldFacet(String, String) All search of a facet field (SortedDocValuesField or SortedSetDocValuesField) with lexical statistics from a TextField (ex: count of words for an author facet)
    • scale(String, String) Data to build chronologies or other charts.
    Author:
    Pierre Dittgen (2009, original idea, creation)

      • cache

        public void cache​(String key,
                  Object o)
        A simple cache. Will be cleared if index reader is renewed. Use SoftReference as a value, so that Garbage Collector will silently delete object references in case of Out of memory.

      • fieldFacet

        public FieldFacet fieldFacet​(String facetField,
                             String textField,
                             org.apache.lucene.index.Term coverTerm)
                      throws IOException
        Get a “facet” object, a cached list of search from a field of type SortedDocValuesField or SortedSetDocValuesField ; to get lexical stats from a text field. An optional “term” (field:value) maybe used to catch a “cover” document (ex: a document carrying metada about a title or an author).
        Parameters:
        facetField - A SortedDocValuesField or a SortedSetDocValuesField fieldName.
        textField - A indexed TextField.
        coverTerm - A couple field:value to catch one document by facet term.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

        Parameters:

      • docOccs

        public int[] docOccs​(String field)
              throws IOException
        For a field, return an array in docId order, with the total number of tokens by doc. Term vector cost 1 s. / 1000 books and is not precise. Norms for similarity is not enough precise (1 byte) see SimilarityBase.computeNorm() https://github.com/apache/lucene-solr/blob/master/lucene/core/src/java/org/apache/lucene/search/similarities/SimilarityBase.java#L185 A field could be recorded at indexation, then user knows its name and get it by docInt(). Solution: pre-calculate the lengths by a cached Freqs object, which have loop
        Parameters:
        field -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

      • books

        public int[] books​(org.apache.lucene.search.Sort sort)
            throws IOException
        Get docId parent documents (books) of nested documents (chapters), sorted by a sort specification. Calculation is not really expensive, do not cache.
        Throws:
        IOException
